description:
'''Wendy Moten''' (born November 22, 1964) is an American jazz singer. Born in [[Memphis, Tennessee|Memphis]] and based in [[Nashville, Tennessee|Nashville]], Moten has had a successful career in music, including several major-label solo records, some international hit songs, and a second career as a touring musician. 

At age 56, she entered the American national talent competition ''[[The Voice (American TV series)|The Voice]].'' She finished as the runner-up on the show, but her career was buoyed by the national exposure. Moten is best known for the single "[[Come In Out of the Rain (song)|Come In Out of the Rain]]", which was a No. 8 hit in the UK in February 1994.
